metaDescription.value: This section answers questions about onboarding and setup capabilities of metR.

documentInfo.metaDescription: This section answers questions about onboarding and setup capabilities of metR.

subHeading.value: This section answers questions about onboarding and setup capabilities of metR.

heading.value: How quickly can I start using metR?

content.value: You can start converting documents immediately after signing in. Many teams run test migrations early to validate output quality before completing advanced setup.

heading.value: Do I need to finish onboarding before converting content?

content.value: No. You can begin converting content without completing all onboarding steps. This allows teams to evaluate value and results before committing to full configuration.

heading.value: What is the difference between an admin and a user?

content.value: Admins manage organization-level settings such as users, projects, and integrations. Users focus on converting, reviewing, and downloading content within assigned projects. This separation keeps governance secure while enabling collaboration.

heading.value: How does role-based access help teams?

content.value: Role-based access ensures users only see and use features relevant to their responsibilities. This reduces errors, protects sensitive settings, and scales cleanly as teams grow.
No. GitHub integration is optional. Teams that already use Git benefit from version control and collaboration, but metR works independently as well.
metR supports modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Safari to ensure reliable access and processing.
